Name: Suspend certain civil penalties for violations related to parking meters during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Title: A Local Law to suspend certain civil penalties for violations related to parking meters during the COVID-19 pandemic

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: October 29, 2020 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - October 29, 2020

Summary: This bill would suspend certain civil penalties for parking meter violations from the beginning of the COVID-19 emergency through September 30, 2020.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. As used in this local law, the following terms have the following meanings: 
      Covid-19 state disaster emergency. The term "Covid-19 state disaster emergency" means the state disaster emergency declared by the governor in executive order number 202 issued on March 7, 2020, and extended thereafter.
      Hearing examiner. The term "hearing examiner" means an examiner presiding over hearings for the adjudication of charges of parking violations as designated by the commissioner of the department of finance pursuant to administrative code section 19-202. 
      Parking meter violation. The term "parking meter violation" shall mean any parking meter violations subject to civil penalties pursuant to subdivision k of section 39-05 of the rules of the city of New York, or any failure to respond to a notice of violation for a parking meter violation pursuant to subdivision a of section 19-211.
      � 2. No monetary liability shall be imposed for any parking meter violation issued from the effective date of the COVID-19 state disaster emergency through September 30, 2020. Upon the presentation of suitable evidence, as determined by the hearing examiner, the hearing examiner shall waive all monetary liability for such violation. 
      � 3. This local law takes effect immediately.



EL
LS #14772
10/9/2020
      1
      
      
      2

Covid-19 state disaster emergency. The term \ldblquote Covid-19 state disaster emergency\rdblquote  means the state disaster emergency declared by the governor in executive order number 202 issued on March 7, 2020, and extended thereafter.\par
Hearing examiner. The term \ldblquote hearing examiner\rdblquote  means an examiner presiding over hearings for the adjudication of charges of parking violations as designated by the commissioner of the department of finance pursuant to administrative code section 19-202. \par
Parking meter violation. The term \ldblquote parking meter violation\rdblquote  shall mean any parking meter violations subject to civil penalties pursuant to subdivision k of section 39-05 of the rules of the city of New York, or any failure to respond to a notice of violation for a parking meter violation pursuant to subdivision a of section 19-211.\par
\cf1\'a7 2. \cf0 No monetary liability shall be imposed for any parking meter violation issued from the effective date of the COVID-19 state disaster emergency through September 30, 2020. Upon the presentation of suitable evidence, as determined by the hearing examiner, the hearing examiner shall waive all monetary liability for such violation. \par
\cf1\'a7 3. This local law takes effect immediately.\cf0\par
